# example.add_numbers { #pytest1.example.add_numbers }

```python
example.add_numbers(a, b)
```

Add two numbers together and return the result.

This is an example function with a numpy style docstring.
We recommend using this style for consistency and readability.

## Parameters {.doc-section .doc-section-parameters}

| Name   | Type   | Description               | Default    |
|--------|--------|---------------------------|------------|
| a      | float  | The first number to add.  | _required_ |
| b      | float  | The second number to add. | _required_ |

## Returns {.doc-section .doc-section-returns}

| Name   | Type   | Description                 |
|--------|--------|-----------------------------|
|        | float  | The sum of the two numbers. |

## Examples {.doc-section .doc-section-examples}

```python
>>> add_numbers(3, 5)
8
>>> add_numbers(-2, 7)
5
```
